definition: woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: Making sure not to compress the back of your neck, tip your head back slightly and gaze at your thumbs.
sentences.chinese: 注意不要压缩脖子后侧，头轻微向后凝视大姆指。

sentences.english: Do not suck your thumb-or anybody else's, for that matter.
sentences.chinese: 不要吮自己的大姆指或是任何人的姆指，这很重要。

sentences.english: Do not suck your thumb-or anybody else's, for that matter.
sentences.chinese: 不要吮自己的大姆指或是任何人的姆指，这很重要。

sentences.english: Besides, the thread rope is respectively curled around the pollex and the middle finger and can prevent the cover body from falling off.
sentences.chinese: 且该线绳分别卷绕于姆指及中指上，可防止套体脱落。

sentences.english: He made no other movement, but stood with his thumbs in his belt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有别的动作，只是把大姆指插在腰带里站着。

sentences.english: Please put your thumbs back together, then split apart your index fingers.
sentences.chinese: 请大家合上大姆指，再张开食指。

definition: the five fingers of one's hand
variant of 腳趾|脚趾[jiao3 zhi3]
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
